website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a comfortable yet affordable nursing bra for daytime and night use, this one fits the bill.
pros: Sleep-deprived mothers appreciate this bra's super soft material, which makes it comfortable enough to wear for nursing and sleeping
This bra is convenient for mid-night nursing sessions
cons: There is no liner in this bra
Also, some women find that there isn't enough support for side sleepers

customer_reviews.title: Great bra- would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and a good fit! I was an a-cup pre pregnancy and am now probably a large B. I’m in my late third trimester, so I haven’t worn this for nursing but I do love it to just wear at home when I don’t want a full bra but still want some coverage. The material is a little thicker than i expected and it was odd feeling at first, but I got used to it quickly. I’m sure the point of the thickness is to prevent leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday wear, great for sleep
customer_reviews.text: I 100% recommend. I am a 38 C and ordered a large. This bra is extremely comfortable. I forget I'm even wearing it. It is also very easy to nurse without the hassle of a nursing bra that has the front clips. .
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. I am a 36 D and I ordered the large. It does fit a tad small around the shoulders and the bottom of the band but is otherwise a great sleep bra. There is no coverage as far as padding the nipple so this probably isn't a bra you would want to wear going out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money! Gave me a Gross Rash!
customer_reviews.text: Why is it so hard to find a decent sleeping nursing bra?! I'm 5'5", 135 lbs, and wear a 34C and the large size is snug, there's strange gaping along the armpit seam, and the material is scratchy and had no stretch. So disappointed by Lamaze. Really surprised they will put out a product with such poor quality. UPDATE: I tried to sleep in this for 2 hours last night and it was so uncomfortable I couldn't sleep AND it gave me a RASH. I am beyond annoyed that I have to go through the trouble of trying to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Hancyclopedia

customer_reviews.title: No support, but smelly
customer_reviews.text: This felt like a sling for my chest. No shape, no support, and the elastic band underneath sits so weird because it's folded. As my husband commented, it also does nothing to hide your "headlights" if you get cold. I feel like nursing pads would show through this as well. Biggest complaint is the smell! Instantly had a strong chemical smell out of the package.I've never had clothing smell like this, it's worse than getting a new mattress topper or anything like that. Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Srusso93

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it but no. It came in a bag reeking of chemicals. Had a lot of threads hanging off it. I hand washed it with Tide. Still had a chemical air to it. IT GOT A HOLE from hand washing in a bucket and hang drying on a hanger. It put it on the next day. It’s snug. I got a large for a 36c. It’s now been on 8 hours and it’s uncomfortable. There’s a stretchy waistband that is exposed on the sides and back, and it’s thicker than a regular undergarment band, about 1/2 inch. It’s digging into my side and leaving marks. It’s easy for breastfeeding. But overall a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: LesleyP

customer_reviews.title: Finally Soft Bra Support
customer_reviews.text: I am a busty gall, and am tired of soft bras that are simply modesty covers. This does not lift like a push up, underwire obviously. However, in my case it gives a supportive natural look. Restricts jiggling to a minimum, for a soft bra. The band does not dig in. I sized up, and it fits the minimum band size comfortably. Would be good for post operative bra, even if your not expecting and need something that doesn't put much pressure on the ribs. Thank you, have a great day
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I live in these bra now. It is soft, stretchy and of good quality. Took off a star as it rides a bit higher than I would like so have to adjust it occasionally, but I'm 5'7 so may not be a problem for a shorter person. I'm generally between a B and C (Medium in tshirts), expected to be close to D when BF, so bought a Large. Was slightly tight at first, then stretched out a bit. At this point, it is the most comfortable nursing bra I own.
customer_reviews.author: healthyway

customer_reviews.title: Simple, comfy, runs a little small.
customer_reviews.text: It’s simple, sturdy yet soft cotton, and about the level of finish you’d expect for the price. As you can see from the photo, I’m not too busty. I was a 36A before pregnancy/birth, maybe a 36B now that I’m nursing. I ordered a medium; both before and after washing warm & tumble drying normal heat, it fit as snug as I’d want. If your cup size or rib cage is any larger, I’d size up.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Decent support, true to size
customer_reviews.text: I think this bra is pretty true to size. I got a size L (I was a size M/L pre-pregnancy) and it is a little bit tight but I think it'll stretch with time. It provides a decent amount of support (as in it keeps your girls in place but you couldn't do jumping jacks in it). It is good for easy access for breastfeeding (which is why I got it). Update: I’ve had this bra for three months now. After less than a month of wear the material became weakened and there is no support. The bra opens up very easily so I can’t wear it when leaving the house. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Edina

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and I am overall happy I did. These things will not last long, as the threading is already unraveling (still wearable) but it gets the job done those first few weeks of breastfeeding and wanting to wear only comfy things. I wish the straps were a bit thinner, because this looks bad under basically any clothing aside for PJ's or a t-shirt. Overall, I would recommend for new mama's - it's a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: parsonal

customer_reviews.title: Funky smell
customer_reviews.text: The fit: It does the job in preventing my BM from leaking (by putting nursing pads) but it still cuts into my skin somewhat-- I end up feeling a bit suffocated after a few hours even tho the size is supposed up correct. Maybe they run a bit small. Functionality: it's pretty easy to use for breast feeding. Horrible smell: My major complaint is its smell. It came out of the package with this toxic rubbery smell that has been extremely hard to get rid of. I washed it three times with detergent and it still smells! Since the smell is so strong, it makes me doubt the material--being made in China and all that.
customer_reviews.author: SuziTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, must buy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these non stop even before baby was born. They are stretchy so they don’t cause blocked ducts like an underwire. They are soft and gentle on the nipple (once you’re through the first few weeks of crazy sensitivity). I would live in these 24/7 if I could, awake or asleep. That said I think they work best on small to medium size chests, they may be too stretchy for larger busted women.
customer_reviews.author: Cat F.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Maternity bra when I was 3 months along thinking it would help provide some comfort to my changing body at night and be a good thing to have for delivery. It is smaller than expected and the design is really hard to untangle out of the dryer. It also provided no support and would slip up when I raised my arms or through the night as I slept. a larger size may have reduced the slipping, but it also would have provided even less support.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bra I've found my entire pregnancy that fit well, was supportive, and really comfortable. I'm now 37 weeks. I've changed sizes every few weeks back and forth in sizes from a 32DD, 36DDD, and now I'm about a 38DD. The constant changing has caused a lot of rib pain. The first bra that I've found that doesn't dig into my sore ribs all day long. I don't have to worry about it not fitting in a week since its stretchy enough. I will be buying more of these! Packing it in my hospital bag for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Lamaze is lacking quality control
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same quality as the previous ones I have purchased. The first one I ordered was thick, soft, and cottony. The one I just received feels thin, cheap, and is a poly/spandex blend. It doesn’t even seem to be the same style. I’m going to order one more and hope I receive one of better quality like my original one.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually think this is possibly my favourite maternity item so far. I’m 36 weeks pregnant and I bought this mainly so I had something comfortable to wear whilst labouring but when it arrived I couldn’t wait. Super comfortable and I have barely taken it off so far, I’m normally a medium but after reading reviews I ordered a large. Which does fit, I possibly could of ordered a medium just to have it fit a little bit more to my liking but I wasn’t sure that would then fit once my milk comes in. There is no spilling out the sides while sleeping which I love. Overall super happy with this purchase and already have more in my cart.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great sleep bra for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a sleep nursing bra. I have tried other brands. Like Motherhood for instance. I will say this is a better fit verses Motherhood. I am a 38F and bought the XL. It fit perfectly. I will say the other brands are looser fitting where this one fits more snugger. Not to mention half the price! I only bought one. Since I was hesitant, but I will be buying a couple more for sure! I just bought my second one to have on hand. I really like these for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kennysmom

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good for small-sized ladies
customer_reviews.text: Double layer and comfy. Ive worn this for the last 2 weeks out and around and house. Pictures show when I was a 34B at 39weeks pregnant and now at 5 days postpartum and its still enough support for me. The shoulder straps are a little long and wider than normal sports bras so its visible under tops but its fine to me.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Quek

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable Back Elastic
customer_reviews.text: This bra gives ok support, but as far as using it as a "sleep bra," DON'T! I wouldn't recommend these bras to anyone, because of what you can't see in the pictures; the elastic on the back. The elastic on the back of the bra is not good for trying to sleep in. It indents/imprints on your back and ends up making for a rash in the morning. I have worn these many times to see if perhaps it was a one time thing, but alas it has happened every time. Additionally, they tend to make one boob fold under and one fold over the midline piece in an uncomfortable way when you wake up in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Runs Very Small; Not that Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as expected. Runs very small. Recommend ordering at least 2 sizes up if you intend for this to be used as an overnight, not tight bra. Also, the elastic inside the bottom tends to twist, which I find irritating. Wide straps are nice and fabric is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable nursing bra. Cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Don't look any further! I originally bought one nursing bra, size XL. At this point postpartum I am unsure of my breast size, however I have a 38 DD bra that is a bit snug. I bought the XL Lamaze bra and it fits great and is extremely comfortable, I bought a second one and plan on buying a third. I've washed each a few times and hung to dry - the quality is still great. Given the material and size of my breast it is obviously not the most "supportive" nursing bra but it is perfect to wear every day around the house and sleep. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: comfy but didn't need it
customer_reviews.text: bought this because i was told i needed a sleep bra for nursing. I have two nightgowns with built in nursing bras so this bra doesn't get used very often. I tend to use it as a regular bra however nipples tend to be noticable/ the fabric won't provide coverage and the straps are really wide at the top making it impossible to not be noticable. the bra is comfortable though
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Decent for large chest
customer_reviews.text: I got the XXL and my pregnancy size was 34K (US)/ 34H (UK). It doesn’t have the best support but for how big I am it works and is comfortable. The band is definitely a little big and the cups are just about perfect. So as long as you are realistic about your support expectations it’s a nice bra.
customer_reviews.author: merber

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable nursing bra!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it looked more comfortable than the other nursing bras I have & I wanted something to wear around the house. This makes it feel like I'm not wearing anything at all. It is supportive without being too tight & is easy to breastfeed in. I didnt size up, I was a 36A pre pregnancy, not sure what I am now but in other nursing bras I order an large & I got a medium in this one. I love it so much I ordered another one! It's so comfortable to sleep in & you cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: John & Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They are my go to sleeping bra! Soft and comfortable! The elastic isn't too tight and uncomfortable like most. I'm a 42dd and purchased the 2xl and it fits wonderfully plus gives enough support that you're not bouncing out all over. I bought 2 more after I received the first one and will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Lakes

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Nursing Bra for Home
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have stated, this is a good value product. For the money, it is a good nursing bra. Simple design, easy to put on and nurse the baby. There may have been a couple of loose threads on my bra, but I was happy with it considering how much I paid. I had no other quality issues with my bra. This bra is not padded, so there is not much coverage. I would not suggest wearing outside the home unless you are wearing a loose shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Thuy Trang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great nursing bra for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this nursing bra! I's my favourite because all of my other nursing bras are racerbacks so this is such a nice break. Also you can't beat the price and convenience. In opinion it's larger than expected. I am probably smaller to average in the bra department wore a 36c pre pregnancy - I got the large to be safe and that's the size I've worn in other nursing bras. It's slightly larger but still fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Regetting this buy
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to the medela nursing sleep bra, I hate this Lamaze bra. It's too thick in material, the straps are too wide, the seams are really rough and rubs my skin raw. I sized up and it still feels too small. It's so tight under the bust, I feel like I'm being cinched and makes it hard to breath. It may be because the bra is designed whereby the material is overlapping. If I hadn't already removed the tags and washed it, I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: jwhung

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, just supportive enough..
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect, exactly what I wanted. Yeah it’s not super nice Bc it’s cheap BUT it’s soft and comfy and just supportive enough that I could leave the house in it. Also super easy to pump in it hold my breast pump in place that’s a huge plus! Also so perfect for nursing and pumping all through the night while you sleep. I’m going to order another one in black.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. This initially fit ok but after a wash it shrunk a little. The fabric is not as soft as I'd have liked and the seams are pretty chuncky and rough. All in all not comfortable to sleep in with tender breastfeeding breasts. I'd definitely recommend paying a little more for the Kindred Bravery version.
customer_reviews.author: rrr

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small. Pink color way off.
customer_reviews.text: M fit like small or even XS. I an a 34C and the medium was way too small. The pink color is not the blush pink you see in the photos. It’s a tacky bubblegum pink unfortunately. I might have lept it if the size was right, bit it runs very small.
customer_reviews.author: k1000a

customer_reviews.title: Not good for good sleepers!
customer_reviews.text: This bra is very soft but is not stretchy enough to get through the night once baby starts sleeping. After six or seven hours, the bra is WAY too small and the lack of back closure makes for a very uncomfortable removal. The crossed fabric also always means that one boob is being pushed awkwardly aside. While the fit around my ribs is good, the length of the straps is not adjustable so tall moms be extra wary! I am 5'8" and my baby is a big eater and good sleeper. The shorter straps and lack of adequate stretch has made this bra unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sending them back
customer_reviews.text: These are going back. They’re so cheaply made the stitching was all over the place and there was a random tab of fabric on one of them. I tried them on and they were so uncomfortable and I had it on for like 3 min. Going to invest in something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Bjackson

customer_reviews.title: One medium light grey which is great! It was just a tad small for me ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One medium light grey which is great! It was just a tad small for me (i'm normally a 36b but with being pregnant I felt it was a little tight). So I ordered a large dark grey. When the large came and I opened it, it smelled so horrible. I washed it twice and it still stinks. I cant describe the smell but the whole second floor of my house smells like it. I might just throw it in the trash. Two stars. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am glad i know how to sew since it was obvious ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 38C and the XL was on the snug side, but it will do it’s job. I am glad i know how to sew since it was obvious the sems were quickly sewn and already separating. Needed a final stitching to keep the elastic from ripping apart and would’ve been nicer if they wouldve trimmed the edges clean without leaving a bunch of leftover thred. Not sure what i was expecting for such a cheap price, but will make this work.
customer_reviews.author: SammyP

customer_reviews.title: Like a supportive hug for your boobs.
customer_reviews.text: I am newly pregnant and my 34C Breasts are growing and so tender and sore. I bought this to wear under pajamas in a size medium. It feels like a hug for my boobs. Not constrictive and supportive like a sports bra but just perfect for laying on the couch or doing chores around the house. Highly recommend. It does come with a funky moth-ball smell but two washes and it’s totally gone now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual use too!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I got this for wearing at home in hot weather and not for nursing, but it works great. Nice comfy cotton, it's the most comfortable thing I've had for the past couple weeks of 80-95o weather with 80% humidity. Mostly it helps keep everything relatively separated so I don't sweat massively when it's that warm. I might get another just so I don't wear this one out too fast.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Great bra
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bra early on in my pregnancy due to increase breast size. I absolutely love the way this feels and how it fits. I have bought many more after this different brands and none of them compare to this specific one. I am actually going to buy another one today due to the fact that I cannot find another one as comfortable. I give up looking LOL . I was just looking for different styles but at this point I don’t care.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Muriel

customer_reviews.title: Great bra, good size, good material
customer_reviews.text: I love his bra. I'm small and I have a small breast even when breastfeeding and for once this bra is perfect (size S). It's always too big but not this time. This bra is very confortable and the quality is good too. The only thing that sucks a bit is that you have to handwash it... But other than that it's a great bra!! I'm gonna buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Buying again and again
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the lookout for an affordable bra that's specifically good for breast feeding and when I saw the price for this I decided to give it a try! I couldn't be happier. It is the most comfortable bra I've ever worn, it's supportive and thick enough to not reveal anything. I love it so much I've thrown out my old bralettes and am replacing them with these! I am a B36 and the medium black fits me perfectly. My only slight complaint is that after a few washes there were a few threads coming loose but it didn't unravel the bra in any way!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, fits great but smells like gasoline
customer_reviews.text: Strong gasoline or some type of fuel - can smell it as soon as you open the plastic bag, even a little bit before you open it. Little scared to put it in my washer. I'm going to hand wash and then machine wash. I hope the smell goes away or else I will have to return. Fits great, soft but not flimsy, supportive in a natural shape way, not supportive enough for exercise but perfect for day to day 8/31/20. Smell did wash out. I think it took 4-5 washings. It’s good now.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Great bra
customer_reviews.text: I bought it based off of my pre-birth bra size and was surprised that it still fit after my milk supply came in. There are times that I start to get engorged and then it seems a but tight but other than that it has been a great bra. I don't only wear it to bed, I also wear it with t shirts at time. I wouldn't recommend it to people who are wearing anything tight or fancy because it is a semi thick fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh V.

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy and inelastic
customer_reviews.text: I sleep in these bras so I have purchased many over the years. This is the least comfortable brand I have purchased. Pay a little more for something that has been created with more care and concern for your comfort.
customer_reviews.author: D. Holmer

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy seams
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the bra are scratchy. I read the reviews and purchased an XL. My prepregnancy size was 34 DDD. I should have purchased a large. I'm hoping it softens and shrinks a bit in the wash. The cups do push to the side nicely for quick nursing or pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: The seams on the side bothered me at first but now it is my absolute favorite nursing bra. I ended up buying 2 more! I found my dark grey one to be more soft and comfortable than the black one. Very convenient for wearing out and about and for sleeping in. I wish I hadn’t bought any other nursing bras because these are the only ones I like!! Even spending $30-$70 each on expensive bras, these ones are BETTER!!
customer_reviews.author: Monet Delbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bra, Runs Very Small
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews that said to go at least 1-2 sizes larger than the chart recommended. So I went up 2 sizes and it fits great. I like that it fits like a sports bra and will make it easy to breastfeed. The white you can see through a little, so I wouldn't recommend it with white shirts. For the price, this is a great bra.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla A

customer_reviews.title: Good soft fabric.. stretchy
customer_reviews.text: As for right now I loooove it!! Better than those bras with snaps ... we will see how it’s gonna after washing but I really do like it... will switch to this type of nursing bra. As for the sizing..ladies ..I’m 34D and got M... its loose on me ..everywhere.. so i would say don’t go up just in case... I will keep it because I really do like the feeling.. soft... but next time I’m getting S. Will update later to let you know if it stays the same after washing.
customer_reviews.author: MaylandRora

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mid-support all day wear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at 8 weeks pregnant and have been using it since my bras don't fit anymore. The lack of underwire is comfortable and easy to sleep in/transition to day time. My only complaint is that it doesn't have a thicker band or seam at the bottom and unlike the photo, it doesn't form around your ribs like that. It has a really thin (.5") stitched seam around the bottom and the panels wrap into each other making it easier to remove the right breast (or have it pop out). I'm glad I bought this to sleep in and I think it will prove to be incredibly helpful once I'm nursing.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Snyder

customer_reviews.title: This bra is okay but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Consider ordering up a size or two for comfort. Pre-pregnancy I am a size 36 barely B cup and I've ordered both medium and large size in these. I'm usually a medium in everything. The medium was way too small. The large fit better, but it still feels snug and somewhat uncomfortable at times even in a large. I wish this looked better underneath my Old Navy maternity tanks. If you're planning to solely use this for sleep, then you may not care how ridiculous you look in this with other tops, but I wore these bras all throughout the day because my underwire bras just hurt too much and were restrictive.
customer_reviews.author: Amber H.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to sleep in while pregnant and hopefully use when nursing, but it was less comfortable than any of my sports bras and WAY less comfortable than some other pregnancy/nursing sleep bras I have bought. I'm giving it away.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Tight straps
customer_reviews.text: This would be an ok bra if the straps weren't so tight. If they made them adjustable that would work. I would recommend trying a size up unless you like a really tight bra strap. I'm just returning it and not trying a different size in this brand....I've tried multiple brands in this style and I think that the straps on all of them have been very tight.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a large that arrived although it was labeled a large. Seemed to fit like a 32B. The material feels scratchy and thin in addition to being too tight. Not at all what you’d want for a nursing bra.
customer_reviews.author: Lala83

customer_reviews.title: Mild discomfort
customer_reviews.text: The bra would be a wonderful bra EXCEPT the elastic around the shoulders is itchy after about two washes and the elastic at the bottom likes to roll because the band isn't an actual band just a fold at the elastic. Update after labor and when my milk came in I went from a 38 C to a 40 DD it is small now - as in my lower boob is playing peek a boo.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Says Go One Size Up
customer_reviews.text: Update: Medium still works but now that I've tried a different brand, these have fallen in my opinion. They're not as soft and after washing they threading has started to come loose. Try Pea In The Pod nursing bras; they're the best and most comfortable! The front bottom band sits awkwardly...so it's hard to position it correctly b/c it doesn't lay flat (the picture kinda shows this). The directions on there says to go one size up from your pre-pregnancy size. I'm usually a 34C and am now a 36DD and found the medium to fit a tad snug and am concerned what will happen when I wash it.
customer_reviews.author: chinina

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The most uncomfortable bra I have ever had on my body! Design also does not cover my breasts.
customer_reviews.author: ewastoria

customer_reviews.title: SO close... but irreconcilable problems
customer_reviews.text: Too bad. Fit is as expected, and I really wanted a cotton nursing bra. Unfortunately, the elastic along the straps and sides are not covered by fabric, and the fact that they're exposed makes them itchy and they dig into my skin. I also second the other complaints about the bra having a horrible chemical smell--wow! what did they do to this thing?!?? It's not a smell that would wash out completely (and I wouldn't risk trying it). Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Till Face

customer_reviews.title: Mostly comfortable; great for pumping
customer_reviews.text: I like the material and it works for nursing or pumping but it’s a little awkward where the fabric meets in the middle. It rolls up-but it might just be too small on me. The straps are nice and thick but some people may not like that because it’s not like a normal bra or most sports bras. I found it comfortable but it means that the bra shows under some or most of my shirts. I would buy again but maybe in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Korrine

customer_reviews.title: Maternity sleep bra
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS BRA! I am writing this bra as a pregnant first time mom, and I purchased this during my first trimester as I was having a lot of pain/tenderness. This bra feels so comfortable and breathable and really helped alleviate the tenderness. The front is double thickness and the back is single layer. It has gone through many times in the wash - I have two pairs and wear them every night to sleep, and there is minimal to no wear and tear so far. I highly recommend this for a sleeping bra even if you haven't started nursing yet!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Wu

customer_reviews.title: This is a Chinese brand and runs small. Order 1-2 sizes larger if you want it to fit.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't use this product. It's advertised as XL maternity, meaning it should've had room to stretch and grow. It barely fit at all trying my first trimester. Since I live abroad, I waited a very long time to get a swimsuit that didn't fit. I ordered from Amazon because I thought I would be getting an American product that fit American sizes. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Halstead

customer_reviews.title: A must have for nursing.
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I wear this bra all the time right now since I moatly stay home with my baby. I was a 36DD pre-pregnancy, probably a 36DDD now nursing, and I got the large. It fits perfect. I did try a medium but it was too small in the cup area. The waist fit though, but I think that's vsude it's super stretchy. I wish I would've had these with my first baby. It's a pregnancy and nursing must have in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: VeronicaT

customer_reviews.title: Fits Comfortably, Easy Nighttime Feeding
customer_reviews.text: I got the large— 175 lb 5’7” while pregnant. It fits so comfortably, I used it while pregnant and currently while breastfeeding. It allows for expansion as your milk comes in or if you become engorged overnight. I have to sleep with breast pads, and I can easily put them in this bra. It also doesn’t constrict at night and is comfortable enough that I can sleep in it without it bothering me. It’s easy to shift around when my baby wants to feed, and I don’t have to fumble around with any straps in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: AJMama

customer_reviews.title: On the fence about sizing - but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not sure what my size is...I started out as a large 34C and nearing the end of my pregnancy...I have DD bras that are small...I don't even want to think what's higher than that. I got a large and it's...okay. Could be a tad small. What I don't like is the width of the shoulder bands...a little wider than I'd expected from the picture and around the arm in the front, the fabric bows out, doesn't lay flush against my skin. Could be because it's too small? It IS comfortable and not a bad buy for the price. I've been wearing it to sleep and it does breathe nicely.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend going up 1 size in this bra. Maybe 2, depending on how ample your milk supply is. I got rid of the bras I bought because they caused a clogged duct twice, second time resulting in mastitis. It was also a pain to put on because of the stitching, it made it confusing. There is also no snap to take your breast out to nurse so you have to either pull your breast out from under the bra our pull it to the side, which puts your breast at a weird angle and the baby may not want to nurse. I really would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sleeping in first trimester
customer_reviews.text: This has been wonderful for sleeping in since I got pregnant! I usually either slept with just a big t-shirt or a tank top under the t-shirt, but I became too sore to not wear a tank top, and had outgrown the tank top. This has filled in perfectly! I am a D cup and the XL has fit well enough with some room to grow a little more. Sleeping has been much more comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Kassy

customer_reviews.title: Need more than one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so i can sleep on my side without getting clogged ducts. I put it on the night it arrived and I love it so much I’ve been wearing it around the house as well. I just placed an order for two more. It has great support, and is so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Erinhead

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Normally I am a small. I got a small and it fit bu it was a bit tight under my arms and rode up a bit. Love it though. Works perfect under nursing shirts. Is a bit thin but I like this bra better with the nursing shirts nothing to unclip and fold down. Both just slide over. Ordering another one in a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Bluetoothy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable to sleep in. It's got a twisted design that makes it quite annoying sometimes to put on. Also some threading has already came off of mine and I've only wore it maybe 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Cade

customer_reviews.title: No good for large breasts
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is comfy if it fits, but boy is it not intended for larger busts. I saw someone commented similarly earlier but I stupidly thought if I ordered the 2XL I'd be fine. Now, I'm quite busty - I wear a 34H in US sizes (34FF UK). For a comparison, I can fit into a 36DDD at Victoria's secret but it's still not the right size. So it's no secret I've got a large bosom. But the 2XL covered half of each breast, and I'm not exaggerating. My guess is a 2XL might fit more like a true DD or maybe DDD, if that.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Goodman

customer_reviews.title: One of my three daily drivers for 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I have this bra and the La Leche League Pullover Bra. I use them interchangeably, but I find this one to be more comfortable. I had two of these, but the grey one got so weirdly stretched out that my breasts would jostle right out of it when I was just walking about the house. The white one has lasted solidly for eight months however: the elastic has maintained shape, it still fits properly and holds the milk-makers in place. I wear it as an all day bra, so I'm slightly active in it. So I've had 50% success with this bra, but I still always default to this bra because it is the more comfortable of the options!
customer_reviews.author: Crompton

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm the size
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the light gray bra also. The gray fit perfectly and securely. This white fit well, at first, I though. Then I found myself pulling up on the shoulders. When I lay down nursing, the bra offers no support to the side not being nursed. My bra pads fall out and everything with them. The gray one I wear all the time! It has been my favorite nursing bra and I have had many. This is my fourth child and the gray bra is so comfortable. I have ordered another gray one and a pink one, to give them another chance. I really need extras. Besides the size problem, I would recommend this nursing bra.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: If your bigger than a D cup order XL
customer_reviews.text: Im currently 42DD I ordered a large. I wish I would of got an extra large as im sure I will most likely be a 40DDD once my milk comes in. The material is comfortable compared to the target nursing bra I got. You can slightly see my nipples through the shirt. If you look really hard you can see a reused breastmilk pad. I will most likely order this in an XL further down the road.
customer_reviews.author: KashXero

customer_reviews.title: Once I bought the Lamaze Maternity Cotton Spandex Sleep Bra and my nights got much better! It was comfortable enough to sleep in or ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver during my first trimester. My breast were so sore, especially at nighttime, which required me to hold my boobs just to go to the restroom at night (which were frequent potty breaks) in order to reduce the pain. Once I bought the Lamaze Maternity Cotton Spandex Sleep Bra and my nights got much better! It was comfortable enough to sleep in or wear around the house when I didn't have errands to run. It also reduced the pain/soreness felt at night and I no longer had to hold my boobs to go to the restroom. I plan to purchase more of these very soon.
customer_reviews.author: DOB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT plus size
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this is considered plus size since I'm only a size 16 and I needed to get the XXL. The biggest it goes. We'll see how this one fits. UPDATE: Got the 2XL and though it fits great, I still wouldn't consider anything about this bra 'plus size'.
customer_reviews.author: La Gee

customer_reviews.title: Feels horrible
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews. Ordered a large. It fits weird and is not soft. Seems are rough and material is stiff and does not feel like a cotton spandex blend. More like a starched polyester. I didn't have high hopes at $8 but I expected a little more after reading reviews. Don't reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love this nursing bra! It is so much more comfortable than the clip down version. I also love that this is mostly cotton which is great for letting your nipples breathe. I would say this runs a little smaller than I expected. I am currently a 34A and ordered the small and I pretty much fill it up. I think the medium would be too large however and I would recommend this product. I use it during the night and the day because it is so much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: VZ

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered the Charcoal Gray and it is amazing! I then got 2 of the Heather gray and they aren't quite as stretchy as the Charcoal gray one, but they still fit great! Just had my baby and wear them all the time! I don't know what I would do without them!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali-Marie Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Too small/tight
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the as style of bra 2 years ago, and loved them! They were so comfy and fit great so I ordered me new ones as those eventually got stretched out. The replacement ones I ordered fit so tight and barely cover my breasts Unfortunately I assumed these would fit the same and tossed the tags and already washed them before I found out how different they fit or else I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Monteith

customer_reviews.title: Good Design
customer_reviews.text: This is a good design - easy to pull over for nursing. It is quite a bit of fabric, however. It fits like a large sports bra but thanks to the design, does not give the dreaded uniboob look, it's much more flattering. The fabric is kind of crappy; it's a bit uncomfortable around the band and under the arms, but after washing it 3 times it's much better. I don't sleep in this as I don't need the support (unfortunately). I wear this during the day when I need a bra or when I go out in public. It is more comfy than most bras, though again, I don't wear it for heavy support.
customer_reviews.author: KAP

customer_reviews.title: Just bad
customer_reviews.text: I wore a 32d pre-pregnancy and ordered a small and it's too big, making it uncomfortable. It's baggy thick cotton that loosens more as you wear it. I can't get away with wearing it under clothes like I can with some of my other sleep nursing bras. It gets lumpy and bunches up on the sides. It also gets twisted when I wash it and am turning it one way and another to straighten it back out bc of the band. Not comfy at all and just annoying all around.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable bra for maternity and nursing!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable bra during pregnancy and even breastfeeding. I actually am still using it around the house and even as a sports bra now that I'm done breast feeding. As far as the size, I went with the size I was during pregnancy and what I was my last pregnancy. It's cotton while is a must for comfort. I did seem to sweat a lot in it more than other bras when I breast feed which made for a stinky chest (sweat and milk). I'm not sure why since it is cotton! Would I buy it again if I was pregnant again? Yes I would.
customer_reviews.author: vpage

customer_reviews.title: No complains here.
customer_reviews.text: This bra is great for sleep and around the house, love the cotton feel. I wear 36D and ordered large and it fits nicely, will be great for nursing too when the baby is here, easy access and can fit nursing pads. I saw a lot of complains and was hesitant about buying this item because of them but I think this bra is great, it is not overpriced like many maternity stuff. Also, a lot of people said it shrinks in the dryer, well the tag says to lay flat to dry it, I just washed it in my bra mesh in the washer and hanged to dry and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not for me.
customer_reviews.text: The elastic frame was too tight after wearing it all evening. I woke up with pain in my upper back. I wanted to love it- but wished the material was a little looser. Donating it as I don’t think returns are possible after wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: LYO.ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Except for the Side Seams
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, supportive enough for a full b cup. The seams on the sides are not great during pregnancy: having to sleep on your side & on a bulky piece of fabric at the bottom of each of the side seams is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Līzīte R

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this bra. Before pregnancy I was a 34B, and I need a large in this bra, so it runs small. I had to order another one because of my four nursing bras this is the only one I wear. Very comfortable and easy to get the boob out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally a small, but while nursing, I've moved up to a medium in most tops. Medium is the right fit in nursing bras/tanks from Medela, Cantaloop, Bravo, and the G&O'M from Target, but the medium in this is very tight (the elastic band especially, but everything else too). Also, I bought it in white and this material retains stains. My other bras/tanks, come out clean with just a little pre-treating with dish soap, but this one doesn't, and I don't have time for lots of scrubbing and bleaching (not that anyone sees the stains, but still, it's nice to look and feel clean).
customer_reviews.author: AoTombo

customer_reviews.title: Not soft
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely not as soft as advertised. It is tight and gives good support but if you are like me and don’t want anything touching your body during pregnancy then I wouldn’t buy this. I bought another one from buybuy baby, the brand is pea in the pod and it is awesome. That’s the only thing I wear all the time. It’s extremely soft
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, lacking support and coverage.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the obvious purpose of sleeping but I found that the cup size did not allow enough coverage, especially as my breast volume increased while sleeping. This resulted in me being very uncomfortable as my breast shifted inside the cup. Also, when I would get out of bed after a few hours (and my volume was up) I didn't feel that this bra had much support because the material is not very thick. My preference would be for a bra that had more gathering in the front and on the sides that would allow for more volume fluctuation and not stretch the material so much that my tender nipples were compressed against the taut fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Mom

customer_reviews.title: Met Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This bra is pretty comfortable - the fabric is soft and stretchy. I use it mostly for sleeping or around the house when I don't want a "real bra." My skin is super sensitive, so going bra-less can be uncomfortable. I like the design -- it's practical and looks okay. The size is my real problem. The XL was just what I expected, but not exactly what I needed. It's big and provides lots of coverage, but the band is huge. I'm roughly a 36F and sizes S, M, L, and XL just don't provide enough options. I'm thinking about doing some sewing to take and inch or two out.
customer_reviews.author: Preggo Puzzler

customer_reviews.title: Size down!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these bras. One medium and one large. The large one was HUGE on me and I usually wear a large. I ended up keeping the medium and retuned the large.
customer_reviews.author: Mario D

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, easy to nurse while wearing
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much that I bought multiple pairs. They are super comfy and provide support for my post-pregnancy breasts. They are easy to slip off and nurse. I wear them every day. I use my bamboo nursing pads with them because they are not padded but they are perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: TheBerkeleyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great maternity bra for feeding little one.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. The product is very comfortable and fits very well. Washes very well and makes feeding little one hassle free. I like it that it doesn't look like bra and material is thick enough that it's not see through even with the white color. I bought several and been wearing them almost daily since our newest addition.
customer_reviews.author: sp1cyninja

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: The material of this item is poor and makes me very uncomfortable. Please save yourself money and buy a different brand. A new mom deserves something much better.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Truce

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BRA
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BRA!!! I just purchased two more in anticipation of our newborn. I've had significant rib pain with this pregnancy and this provides adequate support for my 38D chest as well as minimizes the pressure on my tender ribs. The only drawback is that nursing pad outlines can be seen with some shirts over the bra, but I'd say that's a minor issue given the benefits of COMFORT and SUPPORT. Truly. I recommend this to any pregnant or nursing mom!
customer_reviews.author: cajunhawk09

customer_reviews.title: maternity bra
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had really great reviews both on Amazon and on mommy blogs (Lucies List, Pregnant Chicken, etc) and it seems good... I normally wear push up bras so wearing something that is essentially a sports bra feels really weird to me and of course isn't as attractive looking under clothes BUT that isn't really the point of a nursing bra lol. baby isn't due for a few more days so I haven't tested actually nursing with it, but I can attest that it is super easy access so I don't foresee a problem! quality seems to be good as well but I haven't worn it much yet so we will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs W

customer_reviews.title: This bra is super comfortable for sleeping and provides easy access for nursing
customer_reviews.text: This bra is super comfortable for sleeping and provides easy access for nursing. I would compare it to a sports bra without the compression factor. It easily holds nursing pads and keeps them in place. I usually wear a medium in maternity clothes but sized up to a have room to grow after pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Good bra, comfortable to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: Previously bought La Leche League bra and returned it for this one. LLL bra had too much exposed elastic. My skin is extra sensitive these days (thank you pregnancy hormones), so the combination of elastic and the fit being a bit smaller than expected caused quite a bit of discomfort. This also has exposed elastic in the back, but not in the front. I fold the elastic band up once, and it works well. I wish they would enclose all of the elastic (as is done in the front), but overall, I am satisfied with this product. Order one size bigger than you may expect. Note: I'm a 32C, and the Medium fits well.
customer_reviews.author: KNK CA

customer_reviews.title: I wear S in pretty much all my maternity clothes
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the only sleep bra that I have found that is comparable to the $45 ones I have seen in other shops. For its price, it does what you would expect. The sizing is off though. I wear S in pretty much all my maternity clothes. I ordered the M, and it was still slightly snug. I am expecting my postpartum weight to come off so I didn't return it. Fast forward a month and it fits much better. I now own four of these. I took one star because my nursing pads don't necessary stay in place at night so I get leakage here and there.
customer_reviews.author: WontonUk1

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium and a large in this product cause the previous reviews said it ran small and I wasn’t sure which would work best for me. Needless to say the medium hardly covered anything. It fit perfect around the chest but I needed like 2 times the fabric to actually cover my breast (mind you I am a 34 DDD). When I tried on the large it was just the opposite problem! It fit my beast however it was so large around the chest I fell out of the bottom. The fabric itself is comfortable and soft but if you are an odd size like myself I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great bra! Careful on sizing
customer_reviews.text: Really like this bra. I tried this and medela and returned the latter. This one is cotton and plenty of material to absorb under boob sweat keeping me dry and cosy. This does run a bit small- I wear a 34D or 36C and the large fits with room to expand when milk comes in. I would not fit a medium as the band would be uncomfortably tight. I grabbed 2 more once I tried it. I got color black, size large.
customer_reviews.author: KNile

product_meta.title: Lamaze Intimates Women's Maternity Overnight Nursing Wide Band Shoulder Straps Bra
product_meta.description: The lamaze sleep bra can be used while you are pregnant as well as after as a nursing bra. This bra is very soft and comfortable and will offer you support while you sleep. Very convenient for mid night nursing sessions
feature_bullets: Nursing bra with surplice neckline and leotard back
